Silly but for kids it's OK

Got this for my sons. Not that great. If you hit the paddle too hard, your own chicken falls through. It's too easy to hit Louie consistently so that he skips over the next 1-2 players, which makes every game feel a bit samey instead of unpredictable and chaotic. I'm wondering if a little oil will make him spin around more unpredictably. I sorta wish he spun around faster. /shrug
basically plays itself. +2 as a drinking game

Pickomino ist ein einfaches Würfelspiel, bei dem Spieler versuchen, „Hühner“ zu sammeln. Die Zufallselemente (Würfeln) dominieren das Spiel, was die Möglichkeiten für emergentes Gameplay begrenzt, aber dennoch taktische Entscheidungen gefordert werden.
My son owns this now
Fun quick, simple, kids game that children seem to really enjoy. This is often our family choice for short warm-up game before to moving into something a little heavier.
Family collection (CGW)

This game was hyped before the word hype even existed...
Fun for kids and drunk adults, but really more a toy than a game.

I achieved the dubious skill of sniping all chickens away in all 3 opponent spaces without them being able to hit Louie even once for a counter-attack... obviously, nobody wanted to play with me ever since - I guess I am a jerk.
4+. Children. 2-4 players - Best: 4
5/10: Silly fun game for young kids and drunks. Just wish the plane would spin a bit faster.

If you can somehow get players to play this, they will play it for longer than they thought they would.
Unironically, a delight. I'm all about this. Timing is a great aspect to build a dexterity game around.
Hilarious fun for all ages. The other kids prefer Coconuts, but I like this one because it is simpler to setup and tear down.

Best drinking game.

A nice little group exercise for attention, focus and reaction. Quite loveable, simplistic, with a great toy factor and a bit trivial if not played with kids.
Children Games Collection

+ It's so simple that it can be taught in a single sentence, yet it remains fun for players of all ages for many repeated plays.
- I wish that there was a way to vary the speed of the game depending on the players' skill levels.

Simple, childish, fun. Nothing else is needed to describe the game.

The easiest game in my collection by far, it's almost a toy.

But it always keep us hooked for a long time.

'Tournament Rules': Every time a player wins a round, they start the next round with one less chicken (put the extras face-up in front of the player). Win a round when you started with only one chicken to win it all.
Silly game probably targeted for kids, but it's a lot of fun with adults too. So far it's been a hit with every group I've introduced it to.
